name: Warm Cabbage, Fennel and Pear Salad
description: This crunchy salad makes an elegant first course or side, but it's hearty enough to be an entree when paired with a crusty artisan bread. We love it served warm. —Grace Voltolina, Westport, Connecticut
recipeIngredient: 1 large fennel bulb, halved, cored and thinly sliced
4 cups shredded or thinly sliced cabbage
3/4 cup crumbled or sliced Gorgonzola cheese

recipeInstructions.text: Peel and core pears; cut into 1/2-in. slices. If desired, toss with brandy. Set pears aside.

In a large skillet, heat oil over medium-high heat. Add fennel; saute until crisp-tender, 2-3 minutes. Add cabbage; toss with fennel. Cook until both are tender, 2-3 minutes longer. Add pears, water, lemon juice, honey, salt and pepper to skillet, gently combining ingredients. Cook until liquid is evaporated, 6-8 minutes.
Transfer to a serving bowl. Top with Gorgonzola cheese and toasted walnuts. Serve warm or at room temperature.

review.reviewBody: Im giving this a 5 star for now just because it looks delicious and tantalizes my taste buds! I'll be making this on Christmas Day and am wondering if I can mix green and purple cabbage for this recipe.
